<div class="article-heading">
<h1 style='color:white !important; font-size:10px!important;'>The African continent is splitting in two and it&#039;s happening faster than we thought</h1>The African continent is splitting in two and it&#039;s happening faster than we thought <div style="clear:both; color:#666666;margin-top:8px;font-size:12px; font-weight:normal;"><span style="font-weight:bold;">Source: </span>Indy100 </div>
<div style="clear:both; color:#666666;margin-top:8px;font-size:12px; font-weight:normal;">
<span><span style="font-weight:bold;">Date: </span>20-03-2018 <span style="font-weight:bold;">Time: </span>10:03:44:pm</span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="article-body">
<div class="article-image"><img style="width:auto; max-height:400px !important;overflow:hidden" src="http://photos.myjoyonline.com/photos/news/201803/470631976870_5707834773903.jpg"></div>
<div class="article-image-caption"></div>
<div id="share" class="parser-ignore"></div>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<!-- /1002554/Myjoyonline_Article_Page_468x78 -->
<div id='div-gpt-ad-1497631620299-0' style='max-width:468px; text-align:center; margin:10px auto;'>
<script>googletag.cmd.push(function(){googletag.display('div-gpt-ad-1497631620299-0');});</script>
</div>
<div class="article-text">
<p>Eastern Africa is splitting from the rest of the continent in a geological event that will occur in millions of years, eventually leaving Africa without its horn.</p>
<p>The geologic rift running down the eastern side of the continent, which will be replaced with ocean, is widening at a faster rate than expected, geologically speaking.</p>
<p>And it may already be causing problems. Kenya&#39;s busy Mai Mahiu road caved in after it developed a volcanic fault-line, the Kenya National Highways Authority told Daily Nation.</p>
<p>Geologist David Adede blames the split&nbsp; - where sections of the road sunk, endangering drivers and holding up traffic, according to The Star - on volcanic activity.</p><!-- /1002554/Myjoyonline.com_InArticle_300x250 -->
<div id='div-gpt-ad-1497631711310-0' style='clear: both;position:relative;text-align:center; max-width:468px; margin:40px auto;'><!-- <div style='font-size:12px; font-weight:bold;position:absolute; right:18%; top:-20px;'>Advertisement</div>--><script>googletag.cmd.push(function(){googletag.display('div-gpt-ad-1497631711310-0');});</script></div><div style='clear:both'></div>
<p><img alt="Image result for The African continent is splitting in two and it's happening faster than we thought" src="data:image/jpeg;base64," style="border-style:solid; border-width:1px; height:250px; width:500px"/></p>
<p>In an interview with NTV, he said: The Great Rift splits Africa into two plates. With what is happening we have established one plate which is the Somali plate is moving away from the other plate at a rate of 2.5cm.</p>
<p>In the near future if this happens we shall have Somali plate separating from the other Nubian plate.</p>
<p>He explained that after the road cracked, a big hole opened up and swallowed all the water (there had been recent flooding in the area), resulting in more cracks in the ground.</p>
<p>He added: There is a great need for researchers to conduct a comprehensive study on the terrain of this region so that they can advise on where roads and residential buildings can be established.</p>
<p><img alt="Image result for The African continent is splitting in two and it's happening faster than we thought" src="data:image/jpeg;base64," style="border-style:solid; border-width:2px; height:500px; width:500px"/></p>
<p>This can play a key role in dealing with such natural disasters should they happen.</p>
<p>The two massive chunks of land - the Nubian plate and the Somali plate - are separating by a few millimetres each year due to a &#39;superplume&#39;, a giant section of the earth&#39;s mantle that carries heat from near the core up to the crust.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
</p>
